title: Peterborough's Rental Market
code: library(rms) library(tidyverse)  local_theme <- function() {   bptheme::theme_blueprint(     plot_background = "white",      base_size = 14,      strip_text_size = 14   ) }

title: Peterborough's Rental Market
text: 2018, earliest year Rental Market Report data available, AMR urban two-bedroom apartment Ontario $1,266, second British Columbia.  2017 2023, AMR urban two-bedroom apartment Ontario increased 37%, tied highest proportional increase Nova Scotia.
code: rmr_t1 |>    filter(     centre |> str_detect(province),     centre |> str_detect("10"),      year == 2018) |>    arrange(amr_2br) |>    mutate(centre = fct_inorder(centre)) |>     ggplot(aes(amr_2br, centre)) +    geom_col(aes(fill = centre |> str_detect("Ontario"))) +    geom_text(aes(x = 15, label = scales::dollar(amr_2br)), hjust = 0, size = 14, fontface = "bold", size.unit = "pt", colour = "white") +   bpscales::scale_fill_blueprint(guide = "none", discrete = TRUE, type = "bipolar", option = "blue_green") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(accuracy = 1), expand = expansion(mult = c(0, .05))) +   local_theme() +    labs(x = "Average Market Rent (2br, 2018)", y = NULL) rmr_t1 |>    filter(year == 2023, centre |> str_detect(province)) |>   arrange(amr_2br_indexed_17) |>    mutate(centre = fct_inorder(centre)) |>     ggplot(aes(amr_2br_indexed_17 - 100, centre)) +    geom_col(aes(fill = centre |> str_detect("Ontario"))) +    geom_text(aes(x = .5, label = scales::percent(amr_2br_indexed_17 - 100, scale = 1, accuracy = 1)), fontface= "bold", hjust = 0, size = 14, size.unit = "pt", colour = "white") +   bpscales::scale_fill_blueprint(guide = "none", discrete = TRUE, type = "bipolar", option = "blue_green") +    scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(scale = 1, accuracy = 1), expand = expansion(mult = c(0, .05))) +    local_theme() +    labs(x = "AMR Growth (2017-23)", y = NULL)

title: Peterborough's Rental Market
text: 2018, AMR urban two-bedroom apartment Peterborough relatively affordable $1,077, ranking 10th 16 Ontario CMAs represented data.  2017 2023, Peterborough’s 2-bedroom AMR increased 42%, fourth highest proportional increase among Ontario CMAs represented data, behind Brantford, Oshawa, Windsor, 5ppt higher provincial average 37%.  2-bedroom apartment Peterborough remains relatively affordable compared Ontario CMAs, 2023 AMR $1,411 still dramatic increase 2018.
code: rmr_t1 |>    filter(     province == "Ontario",      year == 2018) |>    arrange(amr_2br) |>    mutate(centre = fct_inorder(centre)) |>     ggplot(aes(amr_2br, centre)) +    geom_col(aes(fill = centre |> str_detect("Peterborough CMA"))) +    geom_text(aes(x = 15, label = scales::dollar(amr_2br)), hjust = 0, size = 14, fontface= "bold", size.unit = "pt", colour = "white") +   bpscales::scale_fill_blueprint(guide = "none", discrete = TRUE, type = "bipolar", option = "blue_green") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(accuracy = 1), expand = expansion(mult = c(0, .05))) +   local_theme() +    labs(x = "Average Market Rent (2br, 2018)", y = NULL) rmr_t1 |>    filter(year == 2023, province == "Ontario") |>   arrange(amr_2br_indexed_17) |>    mutate(centre = fct_inorder(centre)) |>     ggplot(aes(amr_2br_indexed_17 - 100, centre)) +    geom_col(aes(fill = centre |> str_detect("Peterborough"))) +    geom_text(aes(x = 1, label = scales::percent(amr_2br_indexed_17 - 100, scale = 1, accuracy = 1)), fontface = "bold", hjust = 0, size = 14, size.unit = "pt", colour = "white") +   bpscales::scale_fill_blueprint(guide = "none", discrete = TRUE, type = "bipolar", option = "blue_green") +    scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(scale = 1, accuracy = 1), expand = expansion(mult = c(0, .05))) +    local_theme() rmr_t1 |>    filter(year == 2023, province == "Ontario") |>    arrange(amr_2br) |>    mutate(centre = fct_inorder(centre)) |>     ggplot(aes(amr_2br, centre)) +    geom_col(aes(fill = centre |> str_detect("Peterborough CMA"))) +    geom_text(aes(x = 15, label = scales::dollar(amr_2br)), hjust = 0, size = 14, fontface = "bold", size.unit = "pt", colour = "white") +   bpscales::scale_fill_blueprint(guide = "none", discrete = TRUE, type = "bipolar", option = "blue_green") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(accuracy = 1), expand = expansion(mult = c(0, .05))) +   local_theme() +    labs(x = "Average Market Rent (2br, 2023)", y = NULL)

title: Peterborough's Rental Market
text: 2018 2023, vacancy rate Peterborough fell 1.5% 1%, second lowest rate among Ontario CMAs represented data.  2018 2023, rental market turnover slowed Peterborough even Ontario whole. period, turnover Peterborough fell 18% just 7%, lowest rate among Ontario CMAs represented data.
code: rmr_t1 |>    filter(     !is.na(vacancy),      province == "Ontario",     year %in% c(2018, 2023),     centre |> str_detect("10", negate = TRUE)   ) |>    ggplot(aes(year, vacancy, group = centre)) +    geom_path(aes(colour = centre == "Peterborough CMA", alpha = centre == "Peterborough CMA")) +    geom_point(aes(colour = centre == "Peterborough CMA"), shape = 21, size = 3) +    geom_point(aes(colour = centre == "Peterborough CMA"), size = 1) +    local_theme() +    scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) +     bpscales::scale_color_blueprint(     discrete = TRUE,      type = "bipolar",      option = "blue_coral"   ) +    scale_alpha_manual(     values = c(.3, 1)   ) rmr_t1 |>    filter(     year %in% c(2018, 2023),      province == "Ontario"   ) |>    ggplot(aes(year, turnover, group = centre)) +    geom_path(aes(colour = centre == "Peterborough CMA", alpha = centre == "Peterborough CMA")) +    geom_point(aes(colour = centre == "Peterborough CMA"), shape = 21, size = 3) +    geom_point(aes(colour = centre == "Peterborough CMA"), size = 1) +    local_theme() +    scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)) +     bpscales::scale_color_blueprint(     discrete = TRUE,      type = "bipolar",      option = "blue_coral"   ) +    scale_alpha_manual(     values = c(.3, 1)   )

text: `rms` packages Rental Market Survey RMS data CMHC convenient access R. Currently supports Rental Market Report data 2018 2023.
